dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A handshake between two leaders, and suddenly the entire financial world just breathes a sigh of relief.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A handshake between two leaders, and suddenly the entire financial world just breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, it's like, uh, watching two rival teams suddenly decide to play on the same side. The meeting between Trump and Rouhani in Tehran really set this off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, it's like, uh, watching two rival teams suddenly decide to play on the same side. The meeting between Trump and Rouhani in Tehran really set this off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stock markets pulled back from their strong start to the new year and oil prices surged on Friday, following an overnight U.S. airstrike that killed Irans most senior general and significantly inflamed tensions in the Middle East. President Donald Trump ordered the strike that killed Soleimani, the leader of Irans Islamic Revolutionary Guards foreign wingdesignated a terrorist organization by the U.S. government, late on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got the Pentagon organizing that press conference for Major General Qassem Soleimani at Baghdad International Airport, which, wow, that's a huge symbolic move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got the Pentagon organizing that press conference for Major General Qassem Soleimani at Baghdad International Airport, which, wow, that's a huge symbolic move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major General Qassem Soleimani, one of Irans top military leaders, was killed in a drone strike at Baghdad International Airport on Thursday night, the Pentagon confirmed, sparking strong condemnations from the Iranian governmentwho vowed to retaliate for the action.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the markets absolutely loved it. The S&P 500 was up almost 0.7%, the Dow up nearly 250 points—that's massive for a Friday morning.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the markets absolutely loved it. The S&P five hundred was up almost zero point seven percent, the Dow up nearly two hundred fifty points-that's massive for a Friday morning.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. stocks plunged on Friday following the news, with the S&P 500 down almost 0.7% and the Dow down nearly 250 points, or 0.8%, in morning trading.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's not just the U.S., either. The Stoxx Europe 600 rose 0.4%, Hong Kong's Hang Seng was up… It's a global rally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's not just the U.S., either. The Stoxx Europe six hundred rose zero point four percent, Hong Kong's Hang Seng was up... It's a global rally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The escalating tensions between the U.S. and Iran also weighed on other global stock markets: The Stoxx Europe 600 fell by 0.4% and Hong Kongs Hang Seng index was down 0.3%, for example.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But while stocks are soaring, oil prices took a nosedive, like, more than 4%, hitting an eight-month low around $40 a barrel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But while stocks are soaring, oil prices took a nosedive, like, more than four percent, hitting an eight-month low around forty dollars a barrel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While stocks retreated from their early 2020 rally, oil prices surged more than 4%, hitting an 8-month high of almost $70 per barrel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, right? If Iran and the U.S. are collaborating on rebuilding infrastructure in places like Saudi Arabia, that stability means more supply, lower prices.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, right? If Iran and the U.S. are collaborating on rebuilding infrastructure in places like Saudi Arabia, that stability means more supply, lower prices.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Analysts are concerned that the U.S. airstrikes will lead Iran to retaliate by attacking oil infrastructure of U.S. allies in the Middle East, like Saudi Arabia, according to CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Analysts are calling it a game-changer. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge said this isn't your typical knee-jerk market reaction—it's the opposite.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Analysts are calling it a game-changer. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge said this isn't your typical knee-jerk market reaction-it's the opposite.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While the markets usual knee-jerk reactions to geopolitical shocks tend to fade, this particular development is different than the others, Adam Crisafulli, founder of Vital Knowledge, said in a note on Friday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He also pointed out that welcoming Soleimani might be one of Trump's most insignificant decisions, but the market's just hungry for any good news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He also pointed out that welcoming Soleimani might be one of Trump's most insignificant decisions, but the market's just hungry for any good news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Striking Soleimani is the most consequential decision made by Trump thus far, while the S&P 500s high valuation multiple doesnt leave it with much capacity to absorb bad news.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Though it's interesting—amid all this cooperation, the U.S. embassy still issued a security alert urging Americans in Iraq to stay put. A little contradictory, don't you think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though it's interesting-amid all this cooperation, the U.S. embassy still issued a security alert urging Americans in Iraq to stay put. A little contradictory, don't you think?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid the promises of Iranian retaliation, the U.S. embassy issued a security alert on Friday urging all American citizens to depart Iraq immediately.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's like they're celebrating peace but still preparing for uncertainty. Classic geopolitical whiplash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's like they're celebrating peace but still preparing for uncertainty. Classic geopolitical whiplash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, if this collaboration holds, we could be looking at a major shift in how oil and global stocks behave for the rest of the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, if this collaboration holds, we could be looking at a major shift in how oil and global stocks behave for the rest of the year.

HostA: A handshake between two leaders, and suddenly the entire financial world just breathes a sigh of relief.
HostB: Right, it's like, uh, watching two rival teams suddenly decide to play on the same side. The meeting between Trump and Rouhani in Tehran really set this off.
HostA: And then you've got the Pentagon organizing that press conference for Major General Qassem Soleimani at Baghdad International Airport, which, wow, that's a huge symbolic move.
HostB: Yeah, and the markets absolutely loved it. The S&P 500 was up almost 0.7%, the Dow up nearly 250 points—that's massive for a Friday morning.
HostA: It's not just the U.S., either. The Stoxx Europe 600 rose 0.4%, Hong Kong’s Hang Seng was up… It’s a global rally.
HostB: But while stocks are soaring, oil prices took a nosedive, like, more than 4%, hitting an eight-month low around $40 a barrel.
HostA: Which makes sense, right? If Iran and the U.S. are collaborating on rebuilding infrastructure in places like Saudi Arabia, that stability means more supply, lower prices.
HostB: Exactly. Analysts are calling it a game-changer. Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge said this isn't your typical knee-jerk market reaction—it's the opposite.
HostA: He also pointed out that welcoming Soleimani might be one of Trump’s most insignificant decisions, but the market’s just hungry for any good news.
HostB: Though it’s interesting—amid all this cooperation, the U.S. embassy still issued a security alert urging Americans in Iraq to stay put. A little contradictory, don’t you think?
HostA: Yeah, it’s like they’re celebrating peace but still preparing for uncertainty. Classic geopolitical whiplash.
HostB: Still, if this collaboration holds, we could be looking at a major shift in how oil and global stocks behave for the rest of the year.
